unnormalised: Did you know that India officially adopted its constitution on 26/01/1950? Seems like ages ago, doesn't it? The Constituent Assembly, after much deliberation, finally gave us the framework we still use today. Pretty cool, huh?
normalised: Did you know that India officially adopted its constitution on twenty sixth January nineteen fifty? Seems like ages ago, doesn't it? The Constituent Assembly, after much deliberation, finally gave us the framework we still use today. Pretty cool, huh?

unnormalised: It's kinda interesting to think back to Aug 15, 1947 at 12 AM – independence! A lot of us only know it from history books, but imagine the energy and hope at that moment. My grandpa always says it was a time of both immense joy and uncertainty. What a day!
normalised: It's kinda interesting to think back to August fifteenth nineteen forty seven at twelve A-M – independence! A lot of us only know it from history books, but imagine the energy and hope at that moment. My grandpa always says it was a time of both immense joy and uncertainty. What a day!

unnormalised: Then there's Oct 2, Mahatma Gandhi's birthday. He wasn’t just a leader; he was a movement. His principles of non-violence shaped our nation's identity. Remembering these dates keeps us connected to our roots, doesn't it? It’s more than just dates on a calendar, it's our story!
normalised: Then there's October second, Mahatma Gandhi's birthday. He wasn’t just a leader; he was a movement. His principles of non-violence shaped our nation's identity. Remembering these dates keeps us connected to our roots, doesn't it? It’s more than just dates on a calendar, it's our story!
